data.title: Celebration of a successful Business Meeting
data.text: The food is good, you can have a drink, TV's are there, for sports, or the election watching!  Not Handicap accessible, stairs to get in.  But it's a fun place to go.  Kids are almost always there, and the do serve milk.  Many restaurants don't serve Milk.  Servers are friendly and helpful.  We probably go there once a week.  The freshly made gourmet doughnuts for desert are to die for.

data.title: My life burger goals have been met
data.text:
Met some super cool friends at Levi's on a recent Saturday evening. My expectations for the place were low as I've been disappointed by "gastro" places in the past. This one was amazing. Had the limpias for an appetizer: delish. Had burgers for the main course. Holy mackerel. I don't know what they're putting in their burgers or how they're cooking them? But they need to stop because they are so delicious. Normally, I'll eat half of a restaurant burger and take the rest home for the next day. Not here. Ate the whole thing. Wish my wife hadn't finished hers. :-(

My burger was the "meat candy" model, with bacon and some delicious cheese. They crumble their bacon on these burgers so every bite gets some bacon in it. Brilliant!

Also, I was impressed with their fries. Thin-ish shoestring numbers, but they sprinkle crack on them that made me eat every one, lick my fingers, and was tempted to lick the basket lining but again, my wife held me back. Such a kill joy.

Service was great. Don't remember our waitresses name but was always there when we needed her, had great recommendations, was super cute, and was very friendly.

Levi's is definitely on my list of "oh yeah, we're going back there" places.

data.title: Good food, Duck wings are great!
data.text: Been here a few times, good burgers, salads and beer! The ducks wings are a must try. Reasonable prices big servings.

data.title: Quirky with homemade donuts!
data.text: We happened upon this place before the dinner crowd came in. It was quiet and cool on a blazing hot day. Service was a little slow but we weren't in a hurry. My kale salad was delicious. To offset all the healthiness, I had the homemade strawberry donut for dessert. DELISH. My husband had chocolate and said mine was better. We'll go back. There is a great bar that spans the length of the place. And some of the tables were painted in chalkboard paint. Cute idea.

data.title: Great beer, delicious food, excellent dessert
data.text: Walked in on vacation. Saturday night with my family of nine. They told us it would be a 30-45 minutes wait, which isn't bad for our group on a Saturday at 7:30. We ordered some drinks at the bar and were seated within 20 minutes! Everything we ordered was great, especially the short rib sliders and fajita tacos. Don't leave without trying their made to order donuts! Honey glaze and blueberry glaze were our favorites. You can't go wrong with this fun place, complete with good live music!

data.title: Love the local charm
data.text: We went to Levi's on a Friday night and loved the location and the charm of the establishment. However we were pretty disappointed by the menu and when the food arrived, it was overcooked and no alternatives were offered.

data.title: tomahawk chop is the bomb!!!! & the Duck wings/drums are a close second
data.text: great little hole in the wall with a small but awesome menu that is as inventive as it is delicious there was something for everyone in my family to get full including a home made shake for my otherwise picky wife

data.title: Tuesday
data.text: Really disappointed in this place. Over priced for the quality of the food (poor) and the surly waitress did not improve our outlook.

owner_response.author: Uriah N, Public Relations Manager at Levi's Gastrolounge & Lowbar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Noralou, what dishes did you have? Who was your waitress, so we can have a look see. Thanks
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Gastro Good
data.text: Levi's has been one of my favorite's since it opened, but, had lunch there today and it was a little disappointing.  Not the burger I would normally have no problem driving across town to get. The fries were okay, but a bunch of nubs.  This was the first mediocre experience out of several visits, maybe they were having a bad day.  Hopefully next time will be better.

data.title: Not as good as last year
data.text:
I've eaten at Levi's three time.  The first time was a disappointing Valentines prix fixe menu last year.  We left unimpressed but willing to give it another shot because the Valentines menu didn't seem like their normal type food and we figured they went too far trying to be fancy which wasn't their forte.

The second visit last year was great.  I was with a group from work and had a wonderful croque madame and hand cut fries.  I raved about that meal, absolutely delicious.  Too bad that is no longer on the menu.

The third visit, just this week, left me disappointed again.  I had the club sandwich, which came piled high with a not very good guacamole, that totally overpowered the sandwich.  The sandwich probably would have been good without the guacamole but some other complimentary sauce instead.  I ended up only eating the meat.  Unfortunately the fries are now the frozen variety so that was a let down as well.  In fairness, my dining companion had a burger which she said was very good.

I love local joints, but Levi's leaves me scratching my head in confusion.

data.title: Great meal and wonderful service
data.text: We enjoyed a wonderful meal at Levi's this week!!  Our waitress was just perfect - very friendly, personable, and efficient!  We had the best appetizer - egg rolls with shrimp and a delicious sauce.  Also, my husband had shrimp and grits - he ate every bite - and I had a club sandwich - an ample serving - along with great french fries. This restaurant is a wonderful additon to downtown Rogers!!

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Very good local find!! The sliders are awesome! The beer is cold, I recommend the cheesy fries for an appetizer. Don't forget to finish off with a homemade donut!!

data.title: Absolutely fabulous
data.text: We ate at Levi's last weekend for Valentine's Day and it was the absolute best meal we have had in a long time. The five course meal with pairing was ideal!  We are here again tonight and loved dinner again. The potpie is like nothing I have ever had before and how many words can I use to describe the sloppy joe?  Wow! You will not be disappointed by anything. By the way, try the peppercorn dressing... And by the staff a 6 pack, they deserve it!

data.title: Always exceeds expectations
data.text:
We have been going back periodically to this excellent restaurant in downtown Rogers.
The menu is simple but well executed. Unique dishes and the Lumpias are not to be missed. Everything we have tried, at least 5 of the main meals, are incredible, well thought out.
Bar is excellent and staff is very good.
Well worth the visit again and again.

data.title: Potentially Good
data.text:
We arrived for lunch and loved the ambiance of the cellar. We seated ourselves and after several minutes our frazzled looking waitress arrived. It wasn't crowded.

The menu has several interesting items including frog legs and duck wings. We went more traditional with hamburgers, sloppy joes, and French dips. The sandwiches individually were good. The garlic Parmesan fries came with each meal and were advertised as "cooked to order". They were not close to being warm enough to have just been prepared.

The potential for an awesome gastrolounge is there but it is missing some crucial finishing touches.

data.title: First visit, but we'll be back
data.text: Went there for an early dinner on Friday night and were seated right away. The server was very friendly and attentive. I had the French Deep and an Ozark IPA. Both delicious. Everyone in our group liked the food and atmosphere. One person in our group had the doughnut for desert and he said it was outstanding.

data.title: For Dinner or Relaxing
data.text: We have been here three times now so I can say with confidence that the food is consistently really, really great!  The menu changes from time to time and depending on the day, Sunday brunch for example, so there always seems to be something new to try.  NEVER SKIP THE DONUTS! They are a must and are hot, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside with various types of glazes.  I would give 5 stars but sometimes the service is a bit slow and not as knowledgeable as I would like them to be.  It's not bad by any stretch, maybe just take less of a lax approach.  Check back a little more often and when asked your opinion, give it!  We want to know.

data.title: Amazing steak for 2
data.text: Live dinner band, great atmosphere and a great chef = awesome ! Their tomahawk steak for two is wonderful as well as the other food . We've been here two different times and both were great!!! Service is on spot also !

data.title: Excellent bar and food in Rogers
data.text:
First time visiting and we will be back.
Bar is excellent with fun and unique drinks. Bloody Marys were amazing and well thought out.
Food was incredible as well. Pimento burger very juicy with a great bun. The Lumpias are a must appetizer! Be aware they give you 4 good size pieces so plan on sharing.
Chicken Pot pie is handmade and exceptional. 
We will be back!
Wait staff very engaging and do a very good job!

data.title: Must Visit!
data.text: Very different menu, but not off the wall. I had the hatch chilie burger and my wife had the gnocchi. The burger is handmade, irregular in shape with seasonings. Absolutely delicious. The gnocchi were very light and came in a cream sauce. Again, very good. We loved the ambience, in the lower level of the building with warm wood tones. Service was superb. If your visiting NWA for business (Walmart?) or pleasure, take the short 5 mile drive to downtown Rogers and try this place. You won't be disappointed.
